senses.sense_definition: Relating to the legal right of postliminium, which concerns the restoration of former status, rights, or property to persons or things returning from enemy capture.

examples.text: The treaty included <w>postliminiary</w> clauses to ensure that returning prisoners regained their full citizenship.
Historians debated the application of <w>postliminiary</w> justice in the aftermath of the ancient conflict.
